lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now I have access to all of your character sheets at all times, which alleviates me having to text you all, "What's your maximum hit points now?" and all that shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you just have them? Or do we need to send you our characters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well no, I sent out the link earlier today and you're one of the only ones who hasn't responded yet, but you will, later, that's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't see it, I was recording.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't look at my phone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That means all of you guys were texting in your sessions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam, do you have any words you wanted to say about our sponsor?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do. Here, give this to Matt, he'll need it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The $10 off code "beginnings" can be applied to your preorder. To celebrate, I'm going to personally be giving away one copy of this book to either Travis, Liam, or Marisha, but they have to compete for it. Here's the rules: I'm going to give you a race, class, and character description, just like you can do on D&D Beyond, and all you guys have to do is come up with the name of that character. Laura, Taliesin, and Matt will be the judges. Best out of three wins, all right? You just have to come up with a name for this character, ready? A male stout halfling swamp druid who only wears a diaper made out of kelp and loves to Wild Shape into manatees. Liam, what is the name of that character?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Twill Pillikins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marisha, what is the name of that character?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Squall Squatlock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Merkin Dullbringer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Judges, who wins? Oh, Travis, easy win for Travis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Adding Merkin to a swamp druid was too easy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was you, Liam, until he brought up the Merkin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remember, these characters can all be made on D&D Beyond. The next one is a male tabaxi bard with an electric guitar who constantly plays K-pop songs and has a runny nose. What is his name? Liam O'Brien.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bathtub Stealthcat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marisha Ray. Oh yeah, sorry, three names.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mollysquawk the J-pop Hadockhop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, okay. Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pubert Pimplepop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Judges.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got bribed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Travis again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm purchasable, putting that out there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One more, this one is worth two points. A female kenku paladin with no arms or legs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's a kenku?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kenku's a bird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know. Shut up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who worships the lobster-headed god Blibdoolpoolp, and it is a real god, and is dragged around by a pack of reindeer. Liam, what is the name of that character?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dagon Henry Kissinger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Madame Mannequin Ba-Deece.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Filma Kraken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Judges, Liam, Liam, Marisha, Liam gets two points! Travis gets two points! Marisha wins!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay, golf rules!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will personally buy you one of those books, Marisha, hold me to it. D&D Beyond, everyone, make your character today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you Sam, thank you very much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That got weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Isn't it always, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the one Sam gave me, so we'll see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Foster, so check that out on Tuesday next week. We have a new show called Weave coming up, Marisha, do you want to explain this a little bit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're one episode in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One episode in? That's right, that launched this week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it happened... last night?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wednesday night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wednesday night, it happens after Wednesday Club. It's being GMed by Amy Dallen and it's an interactive storytelling RPG game. It's got all the ladies of Geek & Sundry, so check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a dope jacket, by the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, jealous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get you one, same size. Last week's episode of Critical Role is available in podcast form wherever you can find the greatest podcasts to download. So if you have friends who are listening to the audio, they can do so now and be caught up with you up until after tonight. Also, comic book issue four of Critical Role: Vox Machina Origins is available for digital download anywhere where you can find digital comics for the most part: ComiXology, the Dark Horse app, and other great places.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's so good, Minxie's in there killing things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've got a new one creeping up on the horizon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've read the whole thing, I've seen the pictures.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, any other announcements that I've missed?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Apparently my breath stinks, so if anyone has any gum, I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Send your gum to Geek & Sundry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't send your gum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have something. The Shadow of War expansion pack, The Blade of Galadriel, came out and you can play and be me, so get it and play.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just you, Laura Bailey?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, basically just me, running around Mordor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Donut hole! Donut hole! Donut hole!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got a ring of power and shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so check it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She has a ring of power?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up! What? No. What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He just tunes it out now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Except when he doesn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You sought the answer to this endeavor, you found the devil toad, or the nergaliid, as you discovered, was responsible. You hunted it down, slew it, brought its head back, and after arguing with a very tired and wanting to get it over with lawmaster in Trostenwald, managed to convince her enough to let you off the hook and leave most of the standing legal issues with Gustav, thus disbanding the circus and setting you and Yasha free. Yasha went on her own path while the rest of you, the six of you, decided strength in numbers, and at the time being, you all seem to enjoy each other's company. Purchasing a fresh map, looking at your future prospects and your dwindling funds, you decided to head northward, towards the city of Zadash by way of the Golden Road, past the city of Alfield. And that is where we left off, as you had smacked the rear end of the single horse and cart, and sent it spooked into the northern field.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We chased after it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. You chase after it to keep up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't just lose it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Being relatively before noon at this point in time, you're heading northward along the Amber Road. The well-packed dirt of the ten-foot roadway gives you a clear path towards your next destination. The gentle creak of the cart mingles with the clomping of the horse hooves as you push forward. The midday air is warmer than you expected. The sky's common gray presence is broken into smaller cloud patches, the victorious blue peeking through. You guys continue for a few hours, talking amongst yourselves a bit. If there are any questions you wish to ask each other, now is the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any questions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meaning if there is anything coming out of the city you wanted to talk about, otherwise I'm going to continue to push forward with your journey. So stop me at any point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Beau-- is her face all jibbity-jacked, or is it pretty normal-looking at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not that I watched anything from last week, because I didn't! 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see there is some faint bruising starting to show on the left side of the face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a good shiner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you give as good as you got?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I did pretty good. What color is it right now? Is it in that orange-ish purple--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's got the green-yellow sunset happening, things are starting to spread. Tomorrow will be--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. Got that little orangey. Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really pretty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Significant improvement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That trouble going to follow you as we go on our way, or do you think you're free and clear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing. Just a little friendly sparring. Nothing crazy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anyone want a donut from my bag?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, I'll have a donut, thank you, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would also like a donut, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, here you go. I don't have them in real life, just this one in real life. But in the game, you guys are having delicious donuts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How old are those donuts?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you actually have donuts? I don't understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, here you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, there it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Imagination!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're doing it, Peter, you're doing it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was just going there, damn it! Bangarang!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These donuts are not

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does "not that old" mean, does it mean they're young?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they pretty new?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're pretty new, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three days new? Or-- Forget it, I don't actually want to know the answer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just eat it, it's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it good and do we gain or lose hit points?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No hit point transition, no constitution saves. They're a bit stale, but still tasty enough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any lint from the bag that they were being held in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can chose to remove it if you'd like, but it may be part of the texture. It adds color.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. It's like sprinkles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mollymauk, is this weird for you to not be traveling with your performing family?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's change, but travel is travel, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you travel in a wagon when you were with your family?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes, we traveled forever. It was constantly on the road. Once we left home, we stayed moving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ironically, traveled in the exact wagon that you're in right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Some things don't change. We didn't have much of a chance to see you perform. I saw you do a card reading for Jester, but things got waylaid at the circus. What do you normally do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, things. I'm not really much of a performer, I'm more of-- Help set up. Help run the shows, help make illusions, that sort of thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a techie?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I guess you could say a techie. I show off a little bit of the sword juggling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You juggling those big motherfucking swords?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as he balances one on the edge of the hand and then tosses it up and catches it as it falls, and takes the other one and glides it across, spins it up, catches it on his chin. On his nose; he makes it hop around. It's pretty decent.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Little roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you swallow it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check if you want to try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it's a curved sword. So not the curved ones. But I could probably do a straight sword. I'm not going to swallow a curved sword! That would be very complicated to pull off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If anybody can do it, it's you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That tiefling anatomy is very strange, you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm flexible, but not that flexible. I'm pretty flexible. Yeah, I never nailed anything down for a really good act.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few hours into travel along the road, you catch ahead the sight of another caravan heading southward in your direction. They begin to crest over one of the hills. As you look forward, too, the central portion of the Marrow Valley isn't just a smooth, constant grade. It's a series of rolling hills and high grasses and wheats and grains, and a lot of wild weeds that have taken over the areas between bastions of civilization.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far away are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see up there about maybe a half mile or so, as they crest over one of the hills in the distance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I send Frumpkin ahead and see it, and go blind and deaf here, so I can get a closer look at them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is Frumpkin now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin's a sparrow at the moment. I don't have the components to put him back to the shape he prefers, which is a cat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are the components?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Charcoal and some incense, a kind of incense you have to use. I'm all out. I used it all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not my incense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there money involved?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Money? Well, you have to pay money to get the things to do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's been a couple of things before. He can last. Anyway. Off you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever made him a turtle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He can't hear you right now, unfortunately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever made him a snake? Have you ever made him a roach?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's gone to the other place. He won't be able to respond.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever made him a unicorn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A unicorn would be really cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That would be really cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to see that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They exist, you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your vision crests up with the flight of Frumpkin, make a perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Scanlan. Oh, that's not Scanlan, that's Percy, but you did fuck me, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is very low. We'll just say it fails, because it's a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a two?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I rolled a two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I mean, at a safe enough distance to look down, there are shapes. The most that Frumpkin makes out is that it looks to be six heavy wagons.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Six?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six heavy wagons, each being pulled by a trio of horses.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can rob them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18 horses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we could rob them, or we could go off the road and hide and wait for them to pass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Frumpkin back? Do we know all these things yet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the purposes of this--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pleasant day!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I started muttering as soon as I could see that. What they were, what I saw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look like they're in armor? Do they look like they're soldiers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He can't hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look like they're mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do they look like they're unicorns?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like they're traders? Like

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He can't hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see, are they carrying money? Are they carrying people?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You see, he's not really there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Coming closer down the road now, the gap between your traveling troupe and this caravan grows smaller and smaller. All the rest of you, I'd like to make a perception check, please. I think at this point, Frumpkin has--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would've released it, yeah. He's not back, but I released the sight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception check?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Five!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zwölf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be a pretty tight fit to get both your troupe and their wagons past. Do you guys yield or do you continue to push forward?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would just like to suggest we might give way. There are six of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fine with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, agreed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys skirt your single horse-- poor thing is pulling this cart on its own.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to kill it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we get to be lazy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one in the front has what looks to be a thick scarf tossed over the shoulder obscuring part of the face, and she gives a hand salute up to you as it passes and a bit of a head nod. As you wave your hand frantically, a bit of eye contact is made and continues past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to Nicodranas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No response. The first cart continues past.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi. Hi, are you going to Nicodranas?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next one looks over to you for a second, the head cocked a little bit. "No, we are on our "way to Port Zoon."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "By way of Nicodranas."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Did you come from Zadash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have finished our wares and we have things to "bring back to sell."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far is it to Zadash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Uh..." At this point he's passed by you and his voice gets a bit louder over his shoulder and he's like, "From this point, it's probably around 150 miles."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a better look, too. The ones at the front that were pretty heavily covered, as opposed to the ones in the back which are a little taller, and as you look into the back, there's little flaps and openings on the inside, you can see there's families traveling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like they have any wares that they're traveling to trade?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a 16, I think. Yeah. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing through, you can see the three wagons towards the back seem to be more for transport of people. It seems like either these merchants are bringing their family with them for long treks, so they're not apart from them for so long, or their family is just a family of traders or transport. Looking past them, you can see there are a lot of supplies behind them, but you're not sure if they're wares or just their personal goods.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, feel like making some coin, doing a little bit of a show?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fifth cart's now passed. You're moving on to the sixth cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do these people look like they're in the mood to stop?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do they look sad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do they look sad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's insight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, where do you see that? Oh! There it is. Thank you. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see a pair of children, hard to gauge their age at this distance, but they're under the age of ten at least, and they seem to look relatively bored.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll balance one of the swords on my head and flash the cards and see if anybody bites.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As you drop them all over the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wakka wakka.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They just point and smile as their cart pulls away, the sixth cart making distance from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He can tell your fortune!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They didn't poke the parents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The caravan continues without you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah, it's very good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It means that you're on a cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was the chariot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you normally, you know, hijack a caravan like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, we have in the past. If we are confident we can get away with it, we would. We could--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you get away with something like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a lot of people in that caravan though, it seems like a risky maneuver.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a pretty big matzo ball there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And stealing is wrong. But if you did it, could you get away with it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could probably get away with it. Why? You want to follow them and rob their shit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just going off what you said earlier. I don't want to change your behavior just because you're with us all of a sudden.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, sure. Let's go do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's just trying to get you in trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am not. Merely asking a question.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you join in in the stand off?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, what does that--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you join the stagecoach robbery?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we're pointing them down, reach for the sky!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Careful, those fingers are loaded.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I would ask. Are you asking because that is something that you have no experience with or are you wondering maybe is that something that we could join you in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only because I have no experience in it, I was just curious what it was that you might have done, you know, previously.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you hijack a cart?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we were more small-time thieves. We wouldn't typically hijack moving caravans. Usually we'd wait until they parked somewhere and then just go sneak on and steal something out of the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mostly whatever we can walk away with.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The things with moving carts of that big a family is they tend to prep. You don't know what kind of people or weapons they have with them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Always go for a sure thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know how we're pretty sure that everyone on this road's going to kill us? Yeah, everyone else thinks that, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if you need me to teach you how to steal, you can tag along sometime.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might take you up on that, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing on your path, I want to ask which two of you are taking point in keeping an eye on the road and the landscape around you as you progress?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (fake cough) Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Beau and who else?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So generous of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to do it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say, yeah. I'll take a round. I'm used to keeping an eye out on the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the two of you are taking point up until you guys decide to change it when it comes to travel along the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just general perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. I would like you both, currently about an hour's journey past that intersection with the other caravan, to make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! I bet someone's going to try to hijack our shit on the road just like we were talking about then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not too bad. 18.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Smash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 and eight. Actually, both of you don't really notice anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Take that back. Take it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear the faint sound of it moving the fields across.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a tree that looks climbable that I could get a vantage point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is. It's maybe about 600 feet off the road, but you can try and head over there if you want to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus we've been traveling for what? About hour and a half, two hours now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say total right now, you've been probably on the road for about four hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Anyone want to take a quick pee break?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Let's go over to the bushes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys leave the cart on the road or do you take it off to the side?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should leave a guard with the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should lead it off the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we take it with us fairly easily?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you can. The progress will slow a bit because you're now taking it through the hills and the field and having to push the cart through the grass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we should take it off the road.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just off the road a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just off the road but we don't have to go all the way to the tree, I can--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll sit with the cart for the first roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are you going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just going to go check out this tree over here. See if I can get a little better vantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I have a bird that can go probably higher than the tree, if you want.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, kind of forgot about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you like me to do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe she likes climbing trees.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or you could. I don't want to rob you of the joy of climbing a good tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or falling out of it, which we would really enjoy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be actually extremely--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Both are very pleasant, but I do not necessarily need that to feel fulfilled.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, I will sit in the field then and give him a little chuck under the chin and-- oh, wait. Before I go away, am I looking for anything specific?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just people coming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: People coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you take a moment to step off to the side of the road, pull out some of your travel supplies to feed the horse, give it a rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pick some flowers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're wildflowers. They're bright white, scattered and simple, but they're beautiful in their own right. You all take a bit to relieve yourselves a little ways off the road. You make your way towards the nearest tree and it's a cluster of about five or six that are nearby, this pocket where it seems like some seeds long ago got dropped by a bird, probably, over the sky, and then proceeded to grow and sprout. The lowest branch is about ten feet up, so you're going to have to take a quick leap and try and climb some of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wanted to wait for Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Never mind. You see that tree and you go, "I'll "get to that later."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a damn good tree. I do miss climbing trees.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you need me to lift you up to the branch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your eyes cloud over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They do. As the bird is flying, just for a second, I say: You know, ordinarily-- I can't hear you, but he's a cat almost all the time, so this is a rarity. You'll be able to climb many trees, many other times, but we should take advantage of him. Well, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: None of us were nearby when he was saying all of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys were quite a ways off. No one was in earshot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were shitting in the bushes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A ladybug lands on his nose and goes in his nostril, but he can't feel it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Feel it?! I can feel stuff!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe not this. You're too focused.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's bugs in my nose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It tickles a little bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shove it all in, everybody!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To be fair, your face itches in general from the sheer amount of filth that's on it. It's hard to really differentiate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the middle of the field you hear: Ooh, look at that! What do I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for your birdie.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing over and doing a wide pass around as everyone begins to gather their things and head towards the cart, the road's pretty open. At this point, the previous caravan is invisible from that height, the hills close that distance. You don't see anything coming your way. It seems pretty open and safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I keep flying for a little bit longer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I lift Beau up to the branch just because.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Feels like childhood. Do you want up here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll jump!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I lift her up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We sit up in the branches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's impossible to believe him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything carved in the branches, in the tree trunk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The treant eats you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shh, don't spoil it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No carvings of names or letters, but you do see a few knots in the tree that have currently been carved out and made a home to a number of woodland creatures.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've never climbed a tree before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. This is really pretty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you think lives in that hole?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably very small unicorns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you ever seen an unicorn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I've seen many. The little ones can be as small as hamsters.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pocket unicorns?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where do you find such things?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All over. You just have to know where to look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And believe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's starting to believe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it like being in your head?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's pretty great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The light begins to fade, darker and darker, until you get the sense that you have about 30 minutes before this field goes pitch black.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How cold is it out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see your breath.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's pretty cold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not super thick, but when you exhale you see a bit of the breath before you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we pull off on the side of the road and get a campfire going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd say let's get a bit off the road, if possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like there's any trees or any base of mountains or any place that would be a good sheltered campsite?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are no mountains anywhere in the vicinity. You're in the center of the rolling hills. There is a cluster of trees you could go to that's about 300 feet or so off the road. It's three trees, so it's not a lot of cover, but unfortunately you're in the middle of a valley.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we get the horse over to them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys stop there, get the horse a little bit of water and feed, and the site's yours.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Set a tent. Start a fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is why we should've taken one of the circus tents.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They take an awful lot of time to put up. You do know this. There's a process.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but think about how cool it would be to camp in one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's great, but this is nice, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we collect some wood and start a fire?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's starting the fire?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody want to come with me to find some kindling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have an adventurer's kit. Does that have a tinder in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Go look for some dead-ish branches.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a little-- you be my eyes. It's super dark.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you shouldn't go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what, I'll start digging a little pit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now, hold on. I pull a rag out, and I (poof) one of the Dancing Lights, and make that hooded lantern again so that you can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that light, it's easy enough to find some small kindling. There's not a whole lot in the vicinity, mainly being that it's an open field. But you find a few pieces of fallen tree and general dead plant life in the vicinity that can get

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can chop it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You figure you've made it a little under halfway to Alfield, which is the small city on the way to Zadash. It'll take you a little over a day's travel, or if you push it ahead you could probably make it in a day, but you can run the risk of getting tired. But for resting this evening, who wants to take watch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody. We're all going to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While they decide that, I'm going to pull out my silver thread and I'm going to start winding a 20-foot circle around the fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get my little bouquet of wildflowers and I give it to Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's very nice of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you said all girls like flowers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did I do to deserve this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, you are my friend.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A single tear pours down a porcelain cheek.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that's it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll sit up with you, Jester, and take first watch, 1B.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say for the purposes of expediency on this, I'll take three perception rolls from three different people that are keeping watch throughout the evening. So with the setup of your spell, you go to rest. Jester, you first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god damn it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's pretty good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, one. So pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, natural one. About ten minutes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About ten minutes into your watch, the inspiration hits for you to start drawing interesting faces and weird trees. You start sketching--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little tiny hamster unicorns!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. As you begin to sketch, you are not paying attention at all to the area around you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really cute! All wrapped up in a little swaddling blanket!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little hamster tails! Oh man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Giant miniatures space unicorns. However, even though you rolled really poorly, your watch goes through unabated. Second watch, who's taking that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so tired! (snores)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will stay up for a little bit, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll a perception check, please.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: (chanting) Caleb!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's pretty good. That's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keeping an eye out, you see a little ways off-- it's hard to make out any shapes because of your human eyes and, with the firelight that's near you, your eyes can't adjust to the darkness as well, but there are bits and pieces where the clouds do break, the moonlight comes down and you can see a distant shape that's moving through the field maybe about 400 feet off. You can see it pushing through the height of the grass, moving slowly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I the only one awake at this moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slowly jiggle Nott awake. (whispers) Get up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was violin class! What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put a hand over her mouth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a thing out around our fire a ways off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why did we leave you on watch? You can't see in the dark!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I saw the shape. It's not dark, there's a fire here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let me sneak around and look. Right? We don't want to wake everyone because--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because we want them to die? I think we should probably wake everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it's nothing? Then they'll be upset with us. There's nothing more dangerous than--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I shake Beau awake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, she's the most irritable!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you say I'm fucking irritable?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She said "most beautiful." There's a thing out there in the field. Something is moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can't see! She's human, too! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go look! I can see in the dark.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, wait here!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to dart off in a flanking maneuver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 18 plus stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As soon as I see her do that, I start swatting Fjord on the back to wake him up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance up and see there is not one, but three large buffalo-type creatures that are lumbering through the fields.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Buffalo-type creatures, or buffalo?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not sure. You're not close enough to see. You see they're bipedal, they're thick and muscular, and they have these large horns that curl off to the side and out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bipedal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, quadruped, not bipedal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far am I from the camp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're about, maybe, 80 to 100 feet from it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool. I'm going to pull out a piece of copper wire and, remembering the motions that Caleb taught me, I'm going to twirl it around in my hand and hold it up to my mouth and whisper a Message just to Caleb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, what?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to say: it's three buffalo, or buffalo-type objects. Creatures. What do you want me to do? (fwoosh)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm so proud! I don't know that spell, so I cannot talk back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you can!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? Who said that? If you can can hear me-- I don't think you can-- come back with the group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you hear him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that how Message works?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I can hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The whispers continue back and forth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just one back and forth. I can talk to him, he can reply once. That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For one round.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For one round, so six seconds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a cantrip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, I love it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, if it's a cantrip, you can do it over and over again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a cantrip?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it? Oh, it is! Ooh, this is exciting! I've never had magic before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's two soup cans with a string.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far does it go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there you go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're drawing hamsters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the cutest unicorn hamsters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Nott, what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said to come back, so I'm coming back. On the way back, I'm going to see if they're eating or sleeping. What are they doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just moving. As you head back to the camp, you can see they pass and continue heading in the southwestern direction in the field, not taking notice of your fire or the encampment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They could be good for meat. We could go kill them and eat them for meat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is she back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I scoop her up. Look at you! You cast a spell, you spoke to me!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said to do the hand movements and the whispery thing. And I did it and it worked!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's as simple as that, isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm so proud of you! We need to calm down and go back to bed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but we could've eaten those buffalo-type creatures.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, what the fuck did you wake us up for, anyway?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs nervously) Got you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a joke?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I thought we were all going to die, but it was just-- what was it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three large beasts of burden. Wait, we could use them to pull the cart!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Where are they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They went that way! In the dark!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You sure they were just cows? Or donkeys? Or buffalo-type things?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know! I don't know what they were, but they looked big and able to pull the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go look at one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to go cow-tipping, don't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck yeah! Take me cow-tipping, son! Woo!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Echoes in the field. (echoing sounds)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. Back in college.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to go after them or are we going to go back to sleep?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's go look at one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, shit. I guess we're going to look at a buffalo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still sleeping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While Molly and Jester continue to enjoy their continued long rest, you all interrupt it to get up, and head in the direction of these creatures. I would like you all to make a stealth check, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The four of you, shoulder to shoulder, keeping low, making your way through the field, stepping ever so carefully. And there's this (croaking) as one of you accidentally goes completely foot down on to some sort of field frog that had been there. As the croak hits, you watch as one of the creatures (startled grunting), and they all start running away, spooked by the sound.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we tell what they are? Now that we're closer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check, if you want to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to, with my darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At disadvantage on you, unfortunately, at this distance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Welcome to human.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look like buffalo-like creatures.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look like buffalo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll never know what they were.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that was worth a look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You aren't too familiar with a lot of the indigenous animals that live or have been brought to this region if they haven't been near the port towns that you grew up in. You haven't seen these types of creatures before, but you vaguely know they're in the ballpark of what a buffalo, you imagine, looks like.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's vaguely what I imagine a buffalo would look like.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was fun, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Back to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Silently ruffle Nott's hair on the way back to camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stop it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Who's got the third watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Turd watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Molly has the third watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Turd watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you keep an eye out, everyone else sleeps throughout the evening. Eventually, you nod off, and fall asleep with the rest of them. I would like to ask all of you to leave the table for a moment, except for Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For me?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's your turn now!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why? (shouting) Why didn't you roll a higher perception?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I literally don't know. That's actually the problem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just don't get a lich phylactery installed in you again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Travis, it's been nice playing with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god. Oh no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thoroughly enjoyed your accent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In that moment, yellow light bursts before you in the shape of an enormous yellow eye. An impossibly low tone rumbles through the waters around you, shaking you to your core, like an organic war horn the size of a canyon. The eye narrows as the tone grows stronger. A thought enters your mind, a jumble of emotions that your brain attempts to make sense of until a word congeals into the center of your consciousness: "Watching." The eye just looks at you, waiting expectantly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (English accent) What are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Watching."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Watching me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The eye opens a bit and leans closer towards you. "Potential."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My potential? What are you asking of me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Learn."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Learn. What would you have me learn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Learn. Grow. Provoke. Consume."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Learn, grow, provoke, consume. I don't understand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Reward."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A reward for this? I'm listening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Patience." The eye closes, and the light is gone. You feel the darkness and the cold completely suffuse your entire world as the panic and solitude, the true quiet of your unconsciousness, begins to take hold. At that moment, you gasp for breath, and your eyes open, coughing and sputtering in the morning air. If we could have everybody else come back to the table, please! Call them back in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck. Fuck you! What were those words?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Watching, potential, learn, grow, provoke, consume. We'll go over the rest later. Come on in!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we supposed to come back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you're supposed to come back in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're supposed to come in!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, I found a patch of strawberries.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you okay? We're fine? Everything's good?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! We're fine. We're great. Just doing dandy. Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You would tell us if something was wrong?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was fast. You really fought five guys in an alleyway that fast?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sometimes it doesn't take that long, you know what I mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does he look like? What are we doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you have already come to consciousness in the morning air, begun to situate your belongings and put out the embers of the fire that lasted-- pardon-- throughout the night. Your morning belches getting out. Fjord has slept in, and has been ever so still in his sleep. Suddenly, without warning, he suddenly shoots up from his sleep, his eyes wide, and as he opens his mouth, begins coughing and spitting water up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (coughing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, he's injured!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord! Have I ever seen this happen to him before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you speak?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. No, I'm fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you look it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just spit a lot of water out and you were sleeping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was it a lot of water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a sizeable glass filled with water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to walk over and dampen my hand on the water on his chest really quickly and (sniffing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's briny and salty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Huh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are you drinking salt water?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't know that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. (in Sam's voice) Why are you drinking salt water? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jeez, Fjord. That's a lot of drool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it taste like stomach acid? Because that's gross, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only one way to find out!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a momma bird. Everybody have some of what I puked up. It's all good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's talking about acid reflux but he just spit a bunch of water out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay. That's 22.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I don't think it was acid reflux.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I want to shake your hand, but at the same time, I want to smash it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've never been more proud of my wife.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not normal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened, Fjord?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does he seem full of shit to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems like he's covering some confusion or at least trying to deflect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just shook me to my core a little. I'll be fine, really. It's not a common thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why the water, though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You never told me where you got that sword. I mean, because I saw it get a little soggy, a little drippy, when we were fighting the frog thing, so, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance down at your sheath on the ground, it is empty. There is no falchion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. That sword is a pickle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a pickled sword? Are there benefits to pickling your weapons?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a mystery.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's not wrong, though. It actually is a pickle. You can taste it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It is very salty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do like pickles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's not bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is our group going to be all about puns and that stuff?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the lowest form of humor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it really the lowest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Level three.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, there are some pun competitions that get serious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you all right, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I feel funny. Caleb, you remember me asking you about your arcane prowess?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My small experience with the arcane came to me around the same time that sword did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long ago was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not too long ago. Very recent. Right before I met up with Jester.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you in the ocean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was. Did a lot of merchant sailing, previously. Had one trip that didn't go so well. Suffice it to say, after it was done, I found that sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What happened on the trip? Rough waters?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did anyone die?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not real comfortable talking about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about the sword? You said you found it on the ocean, you found on the boat you were on? You were on an island? What do you mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I found it on the shore. When I got back to land, it was just there. I'm not super familiar with a ton of weaponry-- the sword I know, I had some training in it, but this seemed like a unique sword. I felt like it almost called to me. I know how that sounds, but when I picked it up, seemed like everything changed. Ever since, I've been able to do more things. Been able to reach out with some of the stuff I've seen you do. That's why I'm trying to make it up to the Academy. I'm trying to figure out what it is that I have.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM, when I cast Detect Magic in the first game, in the tavern, did that sword light up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm trying to be as forthright as I can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where is the sword right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I make it appear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance around, it's nowhere near you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I focus. Reach down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks down at his open palm, and there is a flash of greenish-blue, teal energy out of his grip. There, clutched within his grasp, you see the falchion, coated in the remnants of sea floor life. You see the barnacles encrusted around the edge and up the back of the blade, as it begins to drip water. The same kind that was coughed up by Fjord this morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can see why I'm a little curious about this item.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a great trick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't even need to touch it, but would you trust me to study it for a moment?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have any experience with items like this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm good at figuring things out. I'm clever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might be able help you with that. I was obsessed with underwater life and mermaids, so I've read a few books.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could we revisit that idea, perhaps? I'm sorry, the night has left me a bit shaken, and I feel like I need a moment to get my bearings, if that's all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, you can understand that we would be curious, but I don't want to push anybody. I mean, we've just met.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course not, and I don't want to make anyone feel uneasy. Again, trying to be as transparent as I can. I don't quite understand, and I appreciate your patience in advance. And I make it vanish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as it just disappears out of your grip.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When he says he doesn't quite understand, is he telling the truth? Is that the same insight check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to make a new one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This whole story, I've been watching.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you can tell, as forthright and honest as you've heard him be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's so disappointing. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, do you think you're slowly turning into water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sighs) No. I hadn't considered that terrifying thought, but thanks. I'll just add that to the fucking list.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you feel like it's happening, let us know and we'll try to catch you in a jar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In a jar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unless he runs away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not going to let you run into the dirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe something can happen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tell you what, I start sweating real hard, I'll let you know, okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has that happened to you before, by the way? The whole, "waking up coughing salt water" thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't really remember.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said that this all started just a few weeks ago, when you met this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't really remember my dreams all that well. They leave me quickly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I remember all of mine, I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've never seen him wake up with water all over him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, excited to see what unfolds. Shall we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you're going to vomit something, salt water's pretty decent. It could have been way worse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of all things, it's way better than vomit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it's far superior. Already, you're proving to be an asset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we get really thirsty, we'll just come to you in the morning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can't drink-- the salt water makes you thirstier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It feels like you should be able to, but you can't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we get back on the road, then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you wouldn't mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How is Horse doing today?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horse?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's Horse?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is his name?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was wondering the very same thing, actually, all night. I was wondering what we would call--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This horse? Maybe he has a name. Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does the horse have a name? If it did, I'll make one up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It probably had a few names, in travel, and you've gone through a few horses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Try not to name them. We're just going to end up eating them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So whatever you come up with.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His name was Winter's Crest. If he lived that long, that was when we were going to butcher him and eat him. You can rename him, it's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it, it's like a celebration.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was the plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe for short we'll call him W.C.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You were going to butcher, at Winter's Crest, and that's a special treat?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It means you're going to eat meat, and then you're going to make some jerky, and then you're going to buy another horse with the money you make.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Interesting point, too: For most of you, Winter's Crest would have little meaning. It's largely celebrated in continents to the west, as it is specific to a historic event that did not happen in Wildemount. But you're a carnival, so you guys have more of a vast and strange knowledge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We celebrate everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When he says Winter's Crest, maybe Beau.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have I ever read about it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like my mom saw lots of visitors from other places.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's possible, but just for a bit of information.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like the snooty town that I came from would have a Winter's Crest festival, like how we have Oktoberfests out here. Even though we have no real business having them, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just glögg. Lots and lots of glögg.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys look off, at this conversation with the horse, the horse is currently about 30 feet off in the field, eating grass out of the field.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you're on the road long enough, you eat a lot of animals. You eat a lot of beasts of burden.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wander over to the wagon and I go and sit down and start drawing, because I need to. I need to spend a little time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: means in Zemnian?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does it mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Toilet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give her a little fistbump.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys gather up, in the fresh morning air, back into the cart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do some pull-ups on the tree branches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Beau gets nice and swole for the morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vasquez.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're just too bad, Vasquez.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think we were talking, Vasquez and Starbuck from the new Battlestar are both good character prints for Beau. Yeah, love that. As you guys bring the cart back up onto the Amber Road, northward, you begin your second-day trek. You guys push on for a few hours. Is it still Beau and Mollymauk keeping point?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll have both of you roll a perception check, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have the highest perception?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh. I did until it bounced.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. I almost got-- samesies. 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have decent perception, what's yours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Calm fields.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I might be distracted looking for things that I can pluck out of the fields. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push on for a few more hours, the afternoon staring to get late. You can choose soon, when it gets dark, to set up camp again and stay another evening out in the fields, or you get a sense looking at the map that you had procured that if you push an extra hour or so past, you could probably make it to Alfield before the night's done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Most of us can see in the dark, it's not a big deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. You guys just hunker down in the wagon, okay? You be safe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Must be nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) Must be nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't say that, ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. You guys push forward, kind of pick up the pace a bit, but the horse and those of you who are on the sides of the cart, if you wish to, you can jog along the side to alleviate some of the burden.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to scan still while I'm--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping an eye out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With my shitty vision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The sun does eventually close towards the Cyrios Mountains to the west and night begins to fall. At this point, you do see just over the distance in the hill as darkness comes, you can see the faint glow, a cluster of light, of a village in the distant hills. You get the sense that this is probably Alfield at the perimeter of your vision. As you continue to push forward, you've now gone past eight hours of continuous travel into the ninth hour. I would like you all to roll a constitution saving throw, please.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. That's because you guys are-- oh, no, you're riding in the cart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm riding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just like: What's wrong?

lines.name: LIAM, SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nein! Cookie monster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So the three of you take one level of exhaustion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw. How do we do that in here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How does that affect us, again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, per point of exhaustion--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you go to your HP.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. So you have disadvantage on ability checks until you take a long rest to get rid of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Disadvantage on abilities?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. On ability checks, so skills and things like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys are-- you're a few-- you're probably about a half mile away from Alfield and it looks, even at this distance, a bit smaller than Trostenwald, where you were. You can see the faint clusters of trees on the north, eastern and northeastern sides of the city, otherwise it's just in this pocket behind a few hills. It's a bit podunk in size, you can gather from this distance, but it's welcoming. There's a flash of orange light on the outskirts of town.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did that look arcane to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it just looked like a flash. I mean, it could have been arcane. It's hard to tell at this distance, it's quite a ways away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a second one. (flash) You faintly see what looks like the distant curl of flames beginning to spread across what appears to be a roof.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Think we just watched someone commit arson, you guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not really a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go kick their ass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like the fire is spreading at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, as you sit here and watch--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're walking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head that direction and start yelling at people.

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Full sprint.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fire!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to hear in the distance a very faint high-pitched yelp or some sort of a screech. It's hard to make it out at this distance, it's an open field area and it's mingling with what sounds like now dozens of voices screaming and entwining. As you can see the uncontrolled flames still progressing on the eastern side of the village, you can just see, as you get within a few hundred feet of the western side of Alfield, people just running. Villagers, probably a few hundred of them, are now just running out of the town as you guys begin to approach. Towards you and out into the field. So as you're approaching, they're coming your direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stop one and ask what happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance over, you see a family of five halflings rushing right past you. The mother is dragging two of the younger ones by the hand while the father is running alongside the eldest daughter, probably in her teens. The father wears a leather cap and has a handlebar mustache and simple farm clothing. As you shout out, he makes your eye contact.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What has happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I don't know what happened. They started to burn the buildings and these things "started rushing. The city is under attack."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (panicked) "Big things. Dog-faced. I can't-- Come on." They just keep running.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dogs are attacking the village!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you guys can see more people are fleeing. As you get closer, about 100 feet outside the city, you watch as the droves of people are beginning to get-- at least either the ones that are actively fleeing have made it out of the city, or in the process the stragglers are still coming through. You see a young human man with scrappy, tattered brown hair, a bit of blood dripping down his face, running before his back arches and he falls into the grass. You can see an arrow protruding from his back. At that point, you can see, standing up from behind one of the exterior walls of the city, a humanoid creature stretching up to about seven feet tall, muscular torso with thin dog-like legs. You watch as it extends its neck with spots of fur, its ears curled upwards as it has a dog-like snout at the front of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Werewolves!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as it leaps onto the back of this fallen villager, bites into the shoulder, and tears a chunk out. Swallows it before it growls into the air (yipping howl).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that a werehyena?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we seen these things before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have. You've encountered a roving band of these on your way southward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think they're-- well, we don't know what they're called. We just fought them. I don't know what they're called; we fought one before!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know how to kill them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You just hurt them until they die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It swallows the flesh, grabs the body, and then darts back into the city, dragging the corpse of the villager it's just killed with it rapidly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it a walled-in city or just parts here and there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. They're small and waist high, and shoulder high walls that are partitions here and there, but it's largely a farming city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not fortified at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he within range to hit with a spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now he's about 200 feet from you and he's running into the city. You can see the flames are further in but you can see the orange glow flickering in the distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a quick scan and see if I see more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck this up. That's okay, 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see more people from the village starting to run out, screaming. You see a handful of crownsguard come out, one of them looks wounded and is, "To the north. Where are they coming from?" You see the two of them dart off northward into the city. What are you guys doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I chase after the crownsguard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go after the one that stole the guy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll go after the one that stole the guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this making my spider sense tingle, can I track them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense, at the moment, there's no active idea that these would be considered a creature that would draw your attention.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you leaving the cart there, on the outskirts?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We leave the toilet behind and we run in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The individual looks back to you. "You, are you able-bodied?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And you're armed."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "30 gold a gnoll ear. Now get in there and help."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A gnoll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 30 gold a gnoll ear?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For each one? How many are there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just go get them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They give you a look like-- "Just go!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just don't want to get overwhelmed is all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott and Jester, do you guys have ways to block arrows?

lines.name: MATT
